Sentence.sentence: It was this lack of information that prompted the launch of I'm First in 2013, originally as an arm of its umbrella organization, the Center For Student Opportunity.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: A recent article in The Harvard Crimson noted the shocking growth of Harvard's public relations arm in the last five years and it questioned whether a focus on risk management and avoiding controversy was really the best outward-looking face of this great institution.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Ask the administration or the Republicans or most academics why America needs more manufacturing, and they respond that manufacturing gives birth to innovation, brings down the trade deficit, strengthens the dollar, generates jobs, arms the military and brings about a recovery from recession.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: From self-service checkout lines at supermarket to industrial robots armed with saws and taught to carve up animal bodies in slaughter-houses, these ever-more-intelligent machines are now not just assisting workers but actually kicking them out of their jobs.
Sentence.come: 出自-2012年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Having committed armed robbery.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: It was this lack of information that prompted the launch of I'm first in 2013, originally as an arm of its umbrella organization, the Center For Student Opportunity.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第三套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Other needles were slipped into my left wrist and, strangely, into my right arm, and then into both my closed eyelids.
Sentence.come: 2018年6月六级真题(第二套)听力 Section C

example.en: Betty went with me to this one-arm joint where I eat.

arma=arm武器,臂+ment物→武器,兵器总称

stems_affixes.value_cn: 陆军, 军队, 大群, 大军

word_mean: 臂：在肩关节和肘之间的上肢部，以与前臂区别
俗指从肩至手的上肢。另见brachium
通常有独立运动的功能，由主要结构伸出
附加物或凸出物，通过它可在口腔内保持可摘部分义齿的位置
一端装在单立柱上，可绕立柱轴线回转，并可沿其轴线上下移动且具有水平导轨的零件。
腕,头足类动物长在口周围由足特化而成的捕食器官。

Sentence.sentence: A birdwatcher, armed with a telescope, found the pet sitting desperately on a rock.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Armed with this knowledge, they're able to carry out individually targeted campaigns to cheat people.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Body language can give away a lot about your mood, so standing with your arms folded can send out a signal that you are being defensive.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语浙江卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: He was riding beside the bus and waving his arms.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I actually began to build up my arm muscles肌肉 shaking my set.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: I thought to myself, how even without an arm he was more of a leader.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If you leave your arms out, they float free in zero gravity, often giving a sleeping astronaut the look of a funny ballet dancer.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: In addition, their arms that are unnecessary for moving around are freed for other purposes, like throwing stones or signaling.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 任务型阅读 原文

Sentence.sentence: In Julius Caesar, for example, Cassius's sly provocation of Brutus to take up arms against Caesar was the basis for a discussion of methods of team building and grass roots organising.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Just before september, Miller was struck by a car and lost his right arm.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: One afternoon, I was crossing the field to go home and saw Miller stuck going over a fence—which wasn't hard to climb if you had both arms.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: One day, armed with a basket of vegetables, he announced he was going to make stew.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语四川卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The inspector waved his arms to try his best to keep steady.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读C 题设

Sentence.sentence: The little pupil took his grandma by the arm and walked her across the street.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语陕西卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: The main question is whether you want your arms inside or outside the sleeping bag.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖北卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Using expansive gestures with open arms makes us feel more powerful, crossing your arms makes you more determined and lying down can bring more insights.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语浙江卷（11月） 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Without his wartime experiences, Hemingway wouldn't have written his famous novel a Farewell to Arms.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语重庆卷 单项填空 原文

lj.lj_ly: kept the newcomer at arm's length at first.

collins.item: PART OF YOUR BODY OR OFSOMETHING ELSE

entry.def: Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that have your hands at the end.

example.ex: She stretched her arms out...
example.tran: 她张开双臂。

example.ex: He had a large parcel under his left arm.
example.tran: 他左胳膊下夹着一个大包裹。

entry.def: The arm of a piece of clothing is the part of it that covers your arm.
The arm of a chair is the part on which you rest your arm when you are sitting down.
An arm of an object is a long thin part of it that sticks out from the main part.

example.ex: ...the lever arm of the machine.
example.tran: 机器的操纵杆

example.ex: ...the arms of the doctor's spectacles.
example.tran: 医生的眼镜腿

entry.def: An arm of land or water is a long thin area of it that is joined to a broader area.

example.ex: At the end of the other arm of Cardigan Bay is Bardsey Island.
example.tran: 在卡迪根湾的另一狭长地段的尾端是巴德西岛。

entry.def: An arm of an organization is a section of it that operates in a particular country or that deals with a particular activity.

example.ex: Millicom Holdings is the British arm of an American company.
example.tran: 米雷康姆控股有限公司是一家美国公司在英国的分支机构。

example.ex: ...the research arm of Congress.
example.tran: 国会的研究部门

entry.def: If two people are walking arm in arm, they are walking together with their arms linked.

example.ex: He walked from the court arm in arm with his wife.
example.tran: 他和妻子挽着胳膊走出法庭。

entry.def: If you say that something costs an arm and a leg, you mean that it is very expensive.

example.ex: A week at a health farm can cost an arm and a leg.
example.tran: 在健身中心呆一个星期的花费会很昂贵。

entry.def: If you hold something at arm's length, you hold it away from your body with your arm straight.
entry.tran: 一臂之远；在伸手可及处

example.ex: He struck a match, and held it at arm's length.
example.tran: 他划亮一根火柴，伸长胳膊举着。

entry.def: If you keep someone at arm's length, you avoid becoming too friendly or involved with them.

example.ex: She had always kept his family at arm's length.
example.tran: 她一直与他的家人保持一定距离。

entry.def: If you say that a list is as long as your arm, you are emphasizing that it is very long.
If you welcome some action or change with open arms, you are very pleased about it. If you welcome a person with open arms, you are very pleased about their arrival.

example.ex: They would no doubt welcome the action with open arms...
example.tran: 他们无疑将热烈欢迎这一举动。

example.ex: Many Panamanians welcomed the troops with open arms.
example.tran: 许多巴拿马人热烈欢迎部队到来。

entry.def: If you twist someone's arm, you persuade them to do something.

example.ex: She had twisted his arm to get him to invite her.
example.tran: 她说服他向自己发出邀请。

collins.tran: 人体或其他物体的一部分

entry.def: Arms are weapons, especially bombs and guns.
entry.tran: 武器，军火，军备（尤指炸弹和枪支）

example.ex: The IRA had extensive supplies of arms.
example.tran: 爱尔兰共和军有庞大的军备。

example.ex: ...arms control.
example.tran: 军备控制

entry.def: If you arm someone with a weapon, you provide them with a weapon.

example.ex: She'd been so terrified that she had armed herself with a loaded rifle...
example.tran: 她吓坏了，于是拿了一支上了膛的步枪。

example.ex: Arming the police doesn't deter crime.
example.tran: 仅仅靠给警察配备武器是无法制止犯罪的。

entry.def: If you arm someone with something that will be useful in a particular situation, you provide them with it.

example.ex: She thought that if she armed herself with all the knowledge she could gather she could handle anything...
example.tran: 她以为，如果获取了所有能学到的知识，就能处理任何事。

example.ex: Armed only with a BBC microphone, I travelled across South Africa meeting writers.
example.tran: 仅仅凭借着一支英国广播公司的话筒，我走遍了南非，会见了许多作家。

entry.def: The arms of a city or of a noble family are its coat of arms. Arms is often used in the names of British pubs.
entry.tran: （城市或贵族家庭的）盾徽，（盾形）徽章，纹章（常用于英国酒馆名中）

example.ex: ...china painted with the arms of Philippe V.
example.tran: 画有腓力五世的盾徽的瓷器

example.ex: ...his local pub, the Abercorn Arms.
example.tran: 他在当地开的酒馆“阿伯康徽章”

entry.def: A person's right to bear arms is their right to own and use guns, as a means of defence.
If soldiers lay down their arms, they stop fighting and give up their weapons.
If one group or countrytakes up arms against another, they prepare to attack and fight them.

example.ex: They threatened to take up arms against the government if their demands were not met.
example.tran: 他们威胁，如果要求得不到满足就要以武力抵抗政府。

entry.def: If a country has people under arms, it has people trained to use weapons and to fight a war.
entry.tran: 武装起来的;处于战备状态

example.ex: There are nearly four million soldiers under arms in this country.
example.tran: 该国有将近400万现役士兵。

entry.def: If people are up in arms about something, they are very angry about it and are protesting strongly against it.
entry.tran: 非常愤怒;极力反对;强烈抗议

example.ex: Environmental groups are up in arms about plans to sink an oil well close to Hadrian's Wall.
example.tran: 环保组织极力反对在哈德良长城附近打油井。

means.word_mean: 1. a human limb; technically the part of the superior limb between the shoulder and the elbow but commonly used to refer to the whole superior limb
2. any instrument or instrumentality used in fighting or hunting;

sentences.sentence: "he was licensed to carry a weapon"

means.word_mean: 3. an administrative division of some larger or more complex organization;
4. any projection that is thought to resemble an arm;
5. the part of an armchair or sofa that supports the elbow and forearm of a seated person
6. the part of a garment that is attached at armhole and provides a cloth covering for the arm
1. prepare oneself for a military confrontation;

sentences.sentence: "The U.S. is girding for a conflict in the Middle East"
"troops are building up on the Iraqui border"

means.word_mean: 2. supply with arms;

sentences.sentence: "The U.S. armed the freedom fighters in Afghanistan"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  arm, earm, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch arm and German Arm
Middle English : from Old French armer (verb), from Latin armare, from arma 'armour, arms'

means: Anti Radar Missile 反雷达导弹

sentences.cn: 或许是对的.但是在美国没有解除核武装之前,每一个国家都有权拥有核武器.
sentences.en: So every nation has the right to arm itself with nukes unless USA disarmed.

sentences.cn: 我国拒绝用生物武器来武装我们的士兵.
sentences.en: Our country refused to arm our soldiers with biological warfare.

sentences.cn: 你信奉了建筑者, 武器也就没用了.
sentences.en: The arm is but naught , save for thy will to serve the Builder.

sentences.cn: 并非所有的武器都能给人以安全感.
sentences.en: All the weapons of war will not arm fear.

sentences.cn: 第十, 暗地运送各种武器,装备他们的一切敌人, 以及可能成为他们敌人的人们.
sentences.en: Tenth , transport various weapons in secret to arm their enemies, and who may become their enemies.

sentences.cn: 在战略武器方面,他显示出了同样的机敏和执著.
sentences.en: He showed similar adroitness and persistence in strategic arm control.

sentences.cn: 国家必须为战士提供武器.
sentences.en: The nation must arm its soldiers for the battle.

sentences.cn: D先生还因以拥有武器和弹药威胁他人生命而被起诉.
sentences.en: Mr Duffy was also charged with possessionfire arm firearm and ammunition with intents to endanger life.

sentences.cn: 他们忍无可忍, 领导乡亲们拿起武器准备行动.
sentences.en: Driven beyond endurance, they led the villagers to arm themselves and prepare for action.

sentences.cn: 随后的两年里，纳赛尔不断与拒绝为他提供武器装备的几个西方大国发生冲突。
sentences.en: In the next two years, Nasser regularly collided with the different Western powers, who refused to arm him.

sentences.cn: 但是，如果你给警察配备武器，难道不会出现更多配备武器的罪犯吗？
sentences.en: But if you arm the police won't more criminals go armed?

sentences.cn: 至于世俗的权力采取什么适当措施,这与教会毫不相干.
sentences.en: The Church has no part in what secular arm may see fit to do.

sentences.cn: 为了这次会议，她准备了所有最新统计资料。
sentences.en: (figurative)She had armed herself for the meeting with all the latest statistics.

sentences.cn: 在扔球之前她的手臂做了下准备活动.
sentences.en: She limbered up her arm before throwing the ball.

sentences.cn: 他一只手臂抱着孩子, 开始给牛准备饲料.
sentences.en: Holding the child on one arm, he set about preparing the food for the cows.

sentences.cn: 尼克手臂上的肌肉涨鼓起来, 准备着向下一砍.
sentences.en: Nick's arm muscles bulged, preparing for the downward stroke.

sentences.cn: 掷球前挥舞(手臂):准备投球时挥动手臂并抬起脚.
sentences.en: Baseball To swing back the arm and raise the foot in preparation for pitching the ball.

sentences.cn: 她准备解开缠在他胳臂上止血的布带.
sentences.en: She prepared to undo the band of cloth around his arm which had served as tourniquet.

sentences.cn: 武装起来,准备战斗.
sentences.en: Arm yourselves and be ready to fight.

sentences.cn: 他们忍无可忍, 领导乡亲们拿起武器准备行动.
sentences.en: Driven beyond endurance, they led the villagers to arm themselves and prepare for action.

sentences.cn: 他举起手臂,提高嗓门, 准备带头发起进攻.
sentences.en: He was raising his arm and his voice , and plainly meant to lead a charge.

sentences.cn: 他们忍无可忍, 领导乡亲们拿起武器准备行动.
sentences.en: Driven beyond endurance, they led the villagers to arm themselves and prepare for action.

sentences.cn: 国家必须装备士兵,以防打仗.
sentences.en: The nation must arm its soldiers for battle.

sentences.cn: 装备他们可说毫无意义.
sentences.en: It was obviously futile to arm them.

sentences.cn: 第十, 暗地运送各种武器,装备他们的一切敌人, 以及可能成为他们敌人的人们.
sentences.en: Tenth , transport various weapons in secret to arm their enemies, and who may become their enemies.

sentences.cn: 随后的两年里，纳赛尔不断与拒绝为他提供武器装备的几个西方大国发生冲突。
sentences.en: In the next two years, Nasser regularly collided with the different Western powers, who refused to arm him.

sentences.cn: 仅仅靠给警察配备武器是无法制止犯罪的。
sentences.en: Arming the police doesn't deter crime.

sentences.cn: 但是，如果你给警察配备武器，难道不会出现更多配备武器的罪犯吗？
sentences.en: But if you arm the police won't more criminals go armed?

sentences.cn: 绑在弓箭手弓臂上的防护垫.
sentences.en: A protective pad strapped to the bow arm of an archer.

sentences.cn: 这个拳击手是用右手出击, 左手防护.
sentences.en: The boxer is hitting with his right arm, guarding with his left.

Sentence.sentence: Familiar consumer products are being adopted by businesses, government and the armed forces.

Sentence.sentence: UPS's charitable arm, the UPS Foundation, uses the company’s logistics to help disaster-struck areas rebuild.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月四级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B
